thread.title_full: Student found dead in halls following ‘chemical incident’ at Bournemouth University

author: georgiadiebelius1
title: Student found dead in halls following ‘chemical incident’ at Bournemouth University
text:
The Bournemouth University’s Student Village where the incident happened (Photo: Google Maps) One student said that police had warned that there was potential for a ‘chemical explosion’.
Student Josh Wilde, 18, told the Daily Star : ‘Apparently a policewoman said that there was a potential for a chemical explosion – and another one said that there is something flammable that is leaking.
‘Some people from the immediate area were evacuated.
Temperatures as low as -10C expected as snow turns to ice overnight ‘At about half past midnight a private ambulance appeared and then came out with a covered body.’
A police spokesman said: ‘Dorset Police were informed of a death at Gillett Road in Poole. It was also reported that the property contained chemical substances.
‘Dorset Police officers – together with Dorset Fire and Rescue Services – entered the address as a precaution.
‘Residents of the premises were evacuated while the substances were removed.’
The death is not being treated as suspicious and the woman’s next of kin has been informed.
